[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 227]
Reasoning: **Analyzing the Shop and Planning for The Flint**

Okay, so I'm in Ante 7, Round 18, with $72 in the bank. The current phase is the shop. My primary objective right now is to maximize my score for the upcoming boss blind, "The Flint," which halves base chips and multipliers. I'm running a Flush build, and the current Flush level is 8, which, even halved, is decent.

My Joker setup is pretty solid: Droll Joker adds +10 Multi to Flushes and multiplies the result by 1.5, Ramen provides a x2 multiplier, The Tribe also provides x2 on Flushes, Perkeo duplicates a consumable at the shop's end, and Stuntman gives +250 Chips, but -2 hand size. I have one consumable, "The Hanged Man". I'm at 5/5 Jokers, and 1/2 Consumables.

In the shop right now, I have Supernova, which adds the number of times the hand is played to the Mult, and Luchador, which disables the boss blind, both at $4. I sold Saturn to ensure Perkeo copies the Hanged Man at the end of the shop. However, if I can find a Jupiter planet card, that would be ideal for immediate scaling. I have enough money that I can afford several rerolls. The reroll cost is currently $3.

Let's do some quick calculations. Even with the Stuntman bonus, the halved base chips and multipliers from The Flint are going to hurt. I'm currently at 370 Chips and 114 Mult. My current best Flush is worth 42,180. The last Ante's big blind was 51,000, and this one will be even higher. The Flint's penalty is substantial.

The current strategy is to use Perkeo to duplicate "The Hanged Man" to thin the deck. However, a "Jupiter" card (Planet Card) to level up my Flushes, duplicated by Perkeo, would be a huge boost. I also have enough money to use rerolls to my advantage. I can't think of any better immediate moves than to use rerolls to search for Jupiter, so I'm going to reroll. I'll need to re-evaluate the shop contents after each reroll.

I can afford this many rerolls to help with my scaling, so let's hit `reroll_shop`.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.
